title: Woman struck by stray bullet in Passaic; 2 teens charged
content:
PASSAIC -- An innocent bystander was struck by a stray bullet Wednesday night after gunfire erupted on a city street during an argument between two teens and others, police said.
The teens are now facing charges of aggravated assault, weapons possession and conspiracy, Detective Andrew White said.
Police responded to Gregory Avenue and Madison Street at about 8:50 p.m. on a report of gunfire and when they arrived they found a 58-year-old city woman who'd been shot in the leg, White said.
The woman told officers she heard four or five shots as she was getting out of her car. As she walking home, the woman realized she'd been shot, White said.
Mathew Gill, 26, of Totowa, was killed in the crash, State Police said.
She was taken to St. Joseph's Medical Center for treatment but her injuries were not believed to be life-threatening.
Witnesses told police they saw two males flee the area on bicycles after shooting and were able to track down one of the teens -- a 16-year-old city boy -- to the area of Oak Street and Myrtle Avenue.
The alleged shooter -- a 17-year-old Clifton boy -- was arrested at his home, White said.
During the course of the investigation, police recovered a .38-caliber handgun.
They were taken to the Essex County Juvenile Detention Center.
Justin Zaremba may be reached at jzaremba@njadvancemedia.com. Follow him on Twitter @JustinZarembaNJ. Find NJ.com on Facebook.
